headline: UK won't give more visas to Indian workers, says PM
summary: Sir Keir Starmer has said the government will not relax visa rules for India, as he embarks upon a two-day trade trip to Mumbai.  The prime minister touched down this morning with dozens of Britain's most prominent business people, including bosses from BA, Barclays, Standard Chartered, BT and Rolls-Royce.  The first full-blown trade mission to India since Theresa May was prime minister, it's designed to boost ties between the two countries.

The first full-blown trade mission to India since Theresa May was prime minister, it's designed to boost ties between the two countries.

headline: How Investors May Respond To Boeing (BA) Ramping Up 737 MAX Production and Securing Major Orders
summary: In a series of announcements made during the past two weeks, Boeing has signaled plans to raise 737 MAX production rates, reported its strongest 737 MAX deliveries since 2018, and secured major new orders including Turkish Airlines’ commitment for up to 75 Dreamliners and Norwegian’s expanded order for 737 MAX jets. This acceleration in production activity and surge in aircraft deliveries reflect increasing operational momentum for Boeing, supported by robust demand across the commercial...

headline: Airbus A320 flies past Boeing 737 as most-delivered jet in history
summary: STORY: Europe's Airbus broke a major commercial barrier on Tuesday.Its A320 family of planes overtook the Boeing 737 to become the most-delivered jetliner in history.Boeing's decades-old record fell as a jet was delivered overnight to Saudi carrier Flynas.It brings deliveries to 12,260 since the A320 began service just under 40 years ago.That's according to industry data from aviation analytics firm Cirium.Airbus didn't immediately respond to a request for comment.The narrow-body jets were originally designed to feed large hubs and later widely adopted by low-cost carriers.Airbus is already the world's largest planemaker by total annual deliveries and it's expanding production in the U.S. and China.Boeing set the standard for narrow-body aircraft production with its popular 737, which was first introduced in the 1960s.But it faced a crisis following two fatal accidents.The company is gradually restoring output under regulatory limits.

raw.headline: Airbus A320 flies past Boeing 737 as most-delivered jet in history
raw.summary: STORY: Europe's Airbus broke a major commercial barrier on Tuesday.Its A320 family of planes overtook the Boeing 737 to become the most-delivered jetliner in history.Boeing's decades-old record fell as a jet was delivered overnight to Saudi carrier Flynas.It brings deliveries to 12,260 since the A320 began service just under 40 years ago.That's according to industry data from aviation analytics firm Cirium.Airbus didn't immediately respond to a request for comment.The narrow-body jets were originally designed to feed large hubs and later widely adopted by low-cost carriers.Airbus is already the world's largest planemaker by total annual deliveries and it's expanding production in the U.S. and China.Boeing set the standard for narrow-body aircraft production with its popular 737, which was first introduced in the 1960s.But it faced a crisis following two fatal accidents.The company is gradually restoring output under regulatory limits.
